segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes by the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing all around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can someone be so focused on a plate while their kitchen floods?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the edge like a little waterfall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll notice before the whole floor is soaked.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids behind her are up to no good, but she’s oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is going to end badly if no one does something soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can already imagine the slippery mess and the broken dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why doesn’t she just turn off the faucet?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just chaotic, and she’s missing it all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR
